title: What Boston meteorologists are saying about today’s damaging winds and ‘First Night flakes’
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: National Weather Service warns of strong to damaging wind gusts in central and western Massachusetts today.
Temperatures in Boston will reach a high of 26°F with wind chills making it feel like 4°F.
Meteorologists report gusts could exceed 50 mph, causing potential tree and powerline damage.

title: The most popular Love Letters relationship problems of 2025
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Love Letters It was a year of OnlyFans, long marriages, and new beginnings.
It’s time for me to share the most popular Love Letters of the year, based on how many people read them.
I’m giving you two lists.

title: Bruins’ future looks bright with James Hagens, Will Zellers dominating at World Juniors
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins Hagens and Zellers combined for three goals in Team USA's win on Monday night.
James Hagens scored two goals for Team USA on Monday.
David Berding/Getty Images By Conor Ryan December 30, 2025 | 7:29 AM 3 minutes to read The future is looking bright for the Boston Bruins.

title: How tall are the Prudential Tower letters?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Wickedpedia Ever wonder how tall the Prudential Tower letters are?

The Prudential tower is among the tallest in Boston.

title: Drake Maye now odds-on favorite for NFL MVP after Matthew Stafford struggles
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Maye leapfrogged Stafford across several sportsbooks after the Rams QB struggled on Monday Night Football.
Drake Maye is now the odds-on favorite to win NFL MVP this season.
(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) The race for NFL MVP has largely been a two-man race down the stretch between Drake Maye and Matthew Stafford.

title: BU hockey’s Cole Hutson avoids major injury after taking puck to back of head
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: College Sports "I wasn't really a hockey player in that moment.
" Cole Hutson needed to be stretchered off after taking a puck to the back of the neck.

title: Drake Maye believes this Boston athlete should be getting MVP consideration
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "He’s doing whatever they need him to, and he can score the ball at will, and he does it nonchalantly.
" Drake Maye is one of the frontrunners for NFL MVP this season.
(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) Drake Maye is making a very compelling argument to win NFL MVP in just his second season in the pro ranks.

title: Why Mike Vrabel put his ‘arts-and-crafts’ skills to the test designing Drake Maye’s game ball
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "He better put it in the quarterback room because I put a lot of time and effort into that thing.

Cooper FOXBOROUGH – Drake Maye had an incredibly efficient performance in New England’s 42-10 romp over the Jets on Sunday.
